qtalmap.description:
XML Schema Definition (XSD) ===========================
Define a schema ---------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2000/10/XMLSchema"> <!-- here the types declaration --> </xs:schema>
To add it on a xml file
Elements --------
## Simple type
Simple type can't contains nested element or any attribute.
Create an element:
<xs:element name="my_elem" type="xs:integer"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation> Somme human readable doc </xs:documentation> <xs:appinfo> computer doc/instruction </xs:appinfo> </xs:annotation> </xs:element>
Declare an element:
<xs:simpleType name="toto"> <xs:restriction base="string"> <xs:pattern value="boy|girl" /> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType>
## Complex type
<xs:element name="hey"> <xs:complexType mixed="true"> <xs:attribute name="toto" type="xs:string" /> <xs:element name="tutu" type="xs:integer" /> </xs:complexType> </xs:element>
mixed --> can contain text and element
### Ref
<xsd:element name="pages" type="xsd:positiveInteger" /> <xsd:element name="auteur" type="xsd:string" /> <xsd:element name="livre"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="auteur" /> <xsd:element ref="pages" /> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element>
### Sequence
Like in DTD (toto,tata) element have to be in the same order
<xs:complexType name="hello"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="toto" type="xsd:string" /> <xs:element name="tata" type="xsd:string" /> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType>
### Stuff
choice: choose one or more all: don't take care of the order
